timings.name: Office Visit Window (Every 12 Weeks after Week 24)

conditions.name: Prediabetes Status at Randomization
conditions.description: Participants classified as having prediabetes at randomization continue for additional 104 weeks
conditions.text: Participants classified as having prediabetes at randomization and who remain on study drug through Week 72, will continue follow-up for an additional 104 weeks

conditions.name: No Glycemic Evidence of T2DM
conditions.description: Participants must not have glycemic assessments suggestive of T2DM
conditions.text: Participants who have no glycemic assessments suggestive of T2DM and meet all other applicable inclusion criteria and none of the applicable exclusion criteria

conditions.name: Intolerable GI Symptoms
conditions.description: Condition for dose modification due to gastrointestinal symptoms
conditions.text: Participants who experience intolerable GI symptoms (for example, nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea) at any time during the study

conditions.name: Perceived Excessive Weight Loss
conditions.description: Condition for dose modification during additional 2-year treatment period
conditions.text: Management of participants with perceived excessive weight loss during the additional 2-year treatment period for participants with prediabetes at randomization

conditions.name: BMI Target Reached
conditions.text: If a BMI ≤22 kg/m2 is reached, the recommended energy intake should be recalculated with no kcal deficit for the remainder of the trial

conditions.name: Temporary Drug Interruption Eligibility
conditions.description: Condition for allowing temporary study drug interruption
conditions.text: A temporary interruption of study drug for 1 dose is permitted, provided the participant has taken the last 3 weekly doses

conditions.name: Pregnancy
conditions.description: Female participants will be withdrawn if pregnant
conditions.text: Female participants will be withdrawn from the study if the participant becomes pregnant

conditions.name: Enrollment Cap for Women
conditions.text: An upper limit of 70% enrollment of women will be used to ensure a sufficiently large sample of men

transitionRules.name: Screening to Randomization Transition
transitionRules.text: Participants who have no glycemic assessments suggestive of T2DM and meet all other applicable inclusion criteria and none of the applicable exclusion criteria at Visit 1 will continue to Visit 2

transitionRules.name: Visit 1 to Visit 2 Transition
transitionRules.text: Participants who have no glycemic assessments suggestive of T2DM and meet all other applicable inclusion criteria and none of the applicable exclusion criteria at Visit 1 will continue to Visit 2

transitionRules.name: Week 72 to Additional Treatment Period
transitionRules.text: Participants classified as having prediabetes at randomization and who remain on study drug through Week 72, will continue follow-up for an additional 104 weeks

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for GI Symptoms
transitionRules.text: If intolerable GI symptoms persist despite the above measures, the investigator should contact Lilly to consider reinitiating study drug at the next-lowest maintenance dose in a blinded fashion (for example, 15 mg reduced to 10 mg, 10 mg reduced to 5 mg, or 5 mg reduced to placebo)

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Persistent GI Symptoms
transitionRules.text: If intolerable GI symptoms persist despite symptomatic treatment, temporary drug interruption, and resumption at a lower dose of study drug, the participant should be discontinued from study drug

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Female participants will be withdrawn from the study if the participant becomes pregnant

transitionRules.name: Dose Escalation Schedule
transitionRules.text: Dosing algorithms starting at a low dose of 2.5 mg accompanied by dose escalation of 2.5-mg increments every 4 weeks

transitionRules.name: Treatment to Safety Follow-up (72 weeks)
transitionRules.text: For participants who discontinue or complete the study within the first 72 weeks, Visit 801 (safety follow-up visit) should be performed 4 weeks after the last visit during the 72-week treatment period

transitionRules.name: Treatment to Safety Follow-up (176 weeks)
transitionRules.text: For participants with prediabetes who complete the 176 weeks or discontinue after Week 72, Visit 802 should be performed 17 weeks after the last visit during the additional 2-year treatment period

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Early Discontinuation of Treatment
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participants unable or unwilling to continue the study treatment for any reason will perform an early discontinuation of treatment (ED) visit

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion at 72 Weeks
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Completion of 72-week treatment period for participants without prediabetes

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion at 176 Weeks
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Completion of 176-week treatment period for participants with prediabetes at randomization

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Female participants will be withdrawn from the study if the participant becomes pregnant

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation for Persistent GI Symptoms
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participant should be discontinued from study drug if intolerable GI symptoms persist despite symptomatic treatment, temporary drug interruption, and resumption at a lower dose

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participants lost to follow-up as described in Section 7.3

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Week 72 Prediabetes Continuation Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point for participants with prediabetes to continue into additional 2-year treatment period

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: GI Symptom Management Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point for managing intolerable GI symptoms including temporary interruption and dose reduction

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Modification for Excessive Weight Loss
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point for dose modification in participants with perceived excessive weight loss during additional 2-year treatment period

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Energy Intake Recalculation Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to recalculate energy intake when BMI ≤22 kg/m2 is reached

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Missed Dose Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: If a dose is missed, take as soon as possible unless within 72 hours of next dose, in which case skip the missed dose
